basics.name: Joseph Cauvy-Foster
basics.label: Graduate
basics.summary:
Recent Computer Science graduate (obtained a First). Looking to start a career in Software Development.
Throughout my academic journey, I honed my skills in Data Visualisation, Python, Machine Learning, Git, Swift, Jupyter, HTML, CSS, LaTeX, Docker, Agile practices, Django and Kotlin. Additionally, I developed strong competencies in listening, receiving feedback, problem-solving, critical thinking, teamwork, written & verbal communication, resourcefulness, creativity, time management, and the ability to learn quickly & pick up new skills.

education.institution: University of the West of England

work.summary: Post-university sabbatical working in a busy pub on the bar, floor, as a waiter and helping out in the kitchen.
Worked in the bar and on tills at a busy stadium during football and ruby games.

highlights: Worked in a team of 50+ employees, fulfilling online orders within a short time frame.
Servicing customers at the till and on the shop floor.
Came second place, in a team of 12, in a competition to sell the most cocktails during a shift to gain a bonus.
Served drinks and made cocktails in a busy bar/club.
Responsibility for verifying inventory every week.

awards.title: Dean's list
awards.awarder: University of the West of England
awards.summary: Awarded for academic excellence during 2021/2022 (+70% average).
